pageContext.claim: “Because it is such a big statement to make but there are those that say how is it possible, and I would -- how is it possible that he didn't know. And I guess you have to put yourself in that category. And I can put myself in that category. I mean, we're talking about pervasive horrible things that were happening and it would certainly be hard to believe that he didn't know what was going on.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump, without evidence, suggests President Obama knew about a conspiracy that Trump has promoted with little evidence -- the idea that a rogue group of FBI agents and Justice Department officials conspired to create a narrative that Trump was beholden to Russian interests during the 2016 presidential campaign. The special counsel's report documents that Russian operatives did hack into Democratic email accounts with the purpose of disclosing the information in order to help Trump's campaign. Moreover, the report says the Trump campaign was receptive to that assistance, even if evidence could not be found that the two sides conspired.
